instruction: What metric was chosen to distinguish between the species of moths Diachrysia chrysitis and D. stenochrysis based on the scales on the brown and golden iridescent areas on the dorsal side of their forewings, and how effective is this metric?
Output:
The metric chosen to distinguish between the moth species in the related study was noninvasive point reflectance spectroscopy in the range from 400 to 2100 nm. This spectroscopic technique measures the reflectance of light at different wavelengths to analyze the composition and structure of the scales on the dorsal side of the forewing.

The effectiveness of this metric was evaluated using machine learning techniques, specifically two independent discriminant analyses: stochastic and deterministic. The more sensitive stochastic approach achieved an average compliance with species identification of 99-100%. This indicates that the spectroscopic measurements, coupled with machine learning, were highly effective in distinguishing between the brown and golden iridescent areas on the forewings of Diachrysia chrysitis and D. stenochrysis moths.
